thailand.description: U.S.-made M16A1 and M16A4 assault rifles, some equipped with M203 40mm under-barrel grenade launchers using M433 HEDP grenades. Used by Thai soldiers in ground engagements.
sources: X post by @war_noir, July 25, 2025: Thai soldiers using M16A4 and M16A1 rifles with M203 launchers.
X post by @war_noir, July 26, 2025: M16A4 rifles captured from Cambodian positions.

thailand.description: Includes 155mm and 105mm towed artillery (e.g., Nexter LG1 Mk III 105mm howitzers) and rocket systems. Used for sustained bombardment in Surin and Ubon Ratchathani provinces.
sources: Reuters, July 25, 2025: Thai mobile artillery units fired towards Cambodia in Surin province.
CNN, July 24, 2025: Thai forces responded with artillery fire after Cambodian rocket attacks.
IISS Military Balance 2025: Thailand has over 2,600 artillery pieces, including 56 155mm and 550 105mm guns.
X post by @Defence_Index, July 26, 2025: Nexter LG1 Mk III howitzers deployed.

thailand.description: M261 and M472 mortar shells used in drone strikes and ground engagements. Thai forces employed mortars in response to Cambodian BM-21 rocket attacks.
sources: Forbes, August 1, 2025: Drone attacks used 60mm M261 and M472 mortar rounds.
CNN, July 24, 2025: Thai mortars responded to Cambodian BM-21 rockets.
X post by @sentdefender, July 24, 2025: Drone strikes with M261 and M472 mortar shells.

thailand.description: Includes M60A3 Patton MBTs (Elbit-upgraded), Type 85 APCs, and T-84 Oplot tanks. Deployed in ground battles near Ta Muen Thom and Preah Vihear.
sources: Times of India, July 25, 2025: Thai tanks engaged Cambodian forces.
IISS Military Balance 2025: Thailand has 400 battle tanks, including 60 Chinese VT-4 and older U.S. M60s.
X post by @Defence_Index, July 26, 2025: M60A3 Patton and Type 85 APCs deployed.
X post by @sentdefender, July 24, 2025: T-84 Oplot tanks in border clashes.

thailand.description: U.S.-made F-16A/B jets, some with Mid-Life Update, armed with Mk 82 (500 lb) bombs and Lizard III or KGGB precision-guided glide bombs. Used for airstrikes on Cambodian military targets, including command posts and artillery positions.
sources: Reuters, July 25, 2025: Thai F-16 jet bombed Cambodian military target.
CNN, July 24, 2025: F-16s dropped bombs near Wat Kaew Seekha Kiri Svarak Pagoda.
Forbes, August 1, 2025: F-16s with GBU-12 Paveway II bombs targeted artillery positions.
X post by @T_55AM1_, July 24, 2025: F-16s armed with Mk 82 bombs and Lizard III kits.
X post by @war_noir, July 25, 2025: F-16s used KGGB glide bombs.

thailand.description: Swedish-made Gripen C/D jets, used in a strike package with F-16s on July 26, 2025. Marked first combat use of Gripens, targeting Cambodian artillery positions.
sources: ABC News, August 1, 2025: Thai forces used Gripen jets in combat.
Forbes, August 1, 2025: Gripen jets with F-16s targeted artillery positions.
IISS Military Balance 2025: Thailand has 11 Gripen C/D jets.

thailand.description: Quadcopter and fixed-wing kamikaze drones, using M261/M472 mortar shells and improvised air-dropped bombs. Targeted Cambodian munitions depots and positions.
sources: Forbes, August 1, 2025: Thai drones used 60mm mortar rounds and kamikaze attacks.
CNN, July 24, 2025: Thai drone launched for two minutes near Ta Muen Thom.
Defence Security Asia, July 25, 2025: Thai armed drones in precision attacks.
X post by @sentdefender, July 24, 2025: Drone strikes with M261/M472 shells.

thailand.description: Alleged use of cluster munitions, condemned by Cambodia and human rights groups as indiscriminate. Thai military acknowledged they 'can be utilized when necessary,' but evidence is inconclusive.
sources: ABC News, August 1, 2025: Cambodia accused Thailand of using cluster munitions.
Al Jazeera, July 25, 2025: Thailand accused of firing into civilian areas, possibly with cluster munitions.
BBC, July 25, 2025: Cambodia’s claim of Thai cluster munitions use unresponded by Thailand.

thailand.description: No credible evidence confirms Thai use of chemical weapons in the 2025 conflict. Claims remain unverified and are not supported by government or news reports.
sources: Bangkok Post, August 1, 2025: RTA dismissed Cambodian claims of chemical weapons as 'baseless and malicious,' citing compliance with the Chemical Weapons Convention.

cambodia.description: Soviet-designed 122mm multiple rocket launchers, used to target Thai positions and civilian areas, including a gas station in Sisaket and Phnom Dongrak hospital.
sources: Reuters, July 24, 2025: Cambodian BM-21 rockets hit Sisaket gas station, killing eight.
ABC News, August 1, 2025: Cambodian BM-21 Grad launchers used in Oddar Meanchey.
IISS Military Balance 2025: Cambodia has 480 artillery pieces, including RM-70 and BM-21 systems.

cambodia.description: Russian-made BMP-3 tanks, part of a $200 million arms deal with China in 2018. Deployed in ground engagements near Preah Vihear and Oddar Meanchey.
sources: ABC News, August 1, 2025: Cambodia deployed BMP-3 tanks in border clashes.
IISS Military Balance 2025: Cambodia has over 200 battle tanks, including BMP-3s.

cambodia.description: Czech-designed multiple rocket launchers, used alongside BM-21s for long-range strikes against Thai military targets.
sources: ABC News, August 1, 2025: Cambodia’s RM-70 launchers used in conflict.
Wikipedia, List of Equipment of the Royal Cambodian Army, July 29, 2025: RM-70 systems in RCAF arsenal.

cambodia.description: Soviet-era T-55 tanks, part of Cambodia’s aging arsenal, used in defensive operations near disputed temples.
sources: IISS Military Balance 2025: Cambodia’s 200+ battle tanks include T-55 series.
ABC News, August 1, 2025: T-55 tanks deployed in border conflict.

cambodia.description: Reconnaissance drones deployed for surveillance, notably on July 31, 2025, over Thai territory, escalating tensions post-ceasefire.
sources: Bangkok Post, August 1, 2025: Cambodian drones conducted reconnaissance in Thai territory.
The Nation, August 1, 2025: Cambodian UAVs detected post-ceasefire.

cambodia.description: Includes AK-47 rifles and Type 56 assault rifles, standard for RCAF infantry in ground engagements.
sources: Wikipedia, List of Equipment of the Royal Cambodian Army, July 29, 2025: AK-47 and Type 56 rifles in use.
IISS Military Balance 2025: Cambodia’s infantry relies on Soviet and Chinese small arms.
